actor_awards.notes: Best remembered for his chilling performance as Bruno Antony in Alfred Hitchcock's 'Strangers on a Train' (1951) and his romantic lead in 'The Clock' (1945). His promising career was cut short by his untimely death at age 32.

filmography.title: Strangers on a Train
filmography.role_description: A charming but psychopathic playboy who proposes a 'criss-cross' murder scheme to a stranger he meets on a train.
filmography.plot: A psychopath forces a tennis star to agree to a theory of 'criss-cross' murders, where they trade victims to avoid suspicion.

filmography.title: The Clock
filmography.role_description: A soldier on a 48-hour leave in New York City who meets and falls in love with a young woman (Judy Garland).
filmography.plot: A soldier on leave in New York meets a girl and they fall in love and get married, all within twenty-four hours.

filmography.title: Since You Went Away
filmography.role_description: The shy, estranged grandson of a boarder who finds love and purpose before going to war.
filmography.plot: With her husband away at war, a woman struggles to keep her family together and support the war effort on the home front.

filmography.title: Thirty Seconds Over Tokyo
filmography.role_description: The engineer/gunner on the Ruptured Duck in the famous Doolittle Raid.
filmography.plot: The story of the first American retaliatory air raid against Japan during World War II, led by Lt. Col. James Doolittle.

filmography.title: See Here, Private Hargrove
filmography.role_description: A naive reporter who gets drafted into the army and writes about his humorous experiences.
filmography.plot: A reporter is drafted into the army during WWII and tries to profit from his experiences by selling stories.

filmography.title: Bataan
filmography.role_description: A young, inexperienced sailor who gets caught up in the brutal jungle warfare.
filmography.plot: A small group of American soldiers defend a bridge on the Bataan peninsula against the Japanese army.

filmography.title: My Son John
filmography.role_description: A government official suspected by his parents of being a Communist spy. Walker died before filming was completed.
filmography.plot: A devoutly Catholic mother begins to suspect that her intellectual son is a Communist spy.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Writing, Motion Picture Story

filmography.title: Vengeance Valley
filmography.role_description: The treacherous son of a rancher who causes trouble for his foster brother.
filmography.plot: A cattle baron's foster son tries to cover up his brother's crimes to protect the family name.

filmography.title: One Touch of Venus
filmography.role_description: A window dresser who kisses a statue of Venus, bringing her to life.
filmography.plot: A window dresser kisses a statue of Venus, which comes to life and falls in love with him, causing chaos.

filmography.title: Till the Clouds Roll By
filmography.role_description: The famous composer whose life and music are celebrated in this biopic.
filmography.plot: A musical biography of composer Jerome Kern, featuring performances of his songs by various MGM stars.

filmography.title: Madame Curie
filmography.role_description: A young assistant who works with the Curies in their laboratory.
filmography.plot: The story of the Polish-French physicist Marie Curie and her discovery of radium.

filmography.title: Song of Love
filmography.role_description: The composer who is a close friend of Robert and Clara Schumann and harbors a love for Clara.
filmography.plot: The life and loves of Clara Schumann, her husband Robert, and their friend Johannes Brahms.

filmography.title: The Sea of Grass
filmography.role_description: The son caught in a conflict between his cattle baron father and his mother.
filmography.plot: A cattle baron's wife bears an illegitimate son, leading to a long-standing family conflict.

filmography.title: Her Highness and the Bellboy
filmography.role_description: A bellboy who mistakes a European princess for a maid and falls for her.
filmography.plot: A bellboy at a New York hotel falls for a visiting princess, unaware of her true identity.

filmography.title: The Sailor Takes a Wife
filmography.role_description: A sailor who impulsively marries a girl he just met, leading to comedic complications.
filmography.plot: A sailor and a girl marry hastily, only to find that married life isn't as simple as they thought.

filmography.title: What Next, Corporal Hargrove?
filmography.role_description: Walker reprises his role as the bumbling soldier in this sequel set in France.
filmography.plot: Corporal Hargrove gets into a series of misadventures in France, including accidentally capturing a town.

filmography.title: The Skipper Surprised His Wife
filmography.role_description: A naval officer who tries to run his household with military efficiency while his wife is laid up.
filmography.plot: A navy commander takes over the household duties when his wife breaks her leg, running the home like a ship.

filmography.title: Please Believe Me
filmography.role_description: A fortune hunter who pursues a woman who has inherited a Texas ranch.
filmography.plot: Three men pursue a woman who has inherited a ranch, not realizing that the ranch is worthless.

filmography.title: The Beginning or the End
filmography.role_description: A military aide who works closely with General Groves during the Manhattan Project.
filmography.plot: A docudrama chronicling the development of the atomic bomb during World War II.

filmography.title: Dancing Co-Ed
filmography.role_description: An early uncredited bit part in a Lana Turner film.
filmography.plot: A studio plants a professional dancer in a college to win a talent contest.

filmography.title: Winter Carnival
filmography.role_description: A minor role as a college student in this romantic comedy.
filmography.plot: A divorced duchess returns to her old college for the winter carnival and rekindles a romance with a professor.

filmography.title: These Glamour Girls
filmography.role_description: Another early uncredited role as a college student.
filmography.plot: A drunken college boy invites a dance hall hostess to his school's dance as a prank.
